cot: The query retrieves data from both the Patient table (T1) and the Laboratory table (T2) via an INNER JOIN, fulfilling the requirement to use both tables.
The query includes the sex column from the Patient table (T1.sex) and the CENTROMEA and SSB columns from the Laboratory table (T2.CENTROMEA, T2.SSB), as required.
The query uses COUNT(DISTINCT T1.ID) to ensure each patient is only counted once, satisfying the requirement for distinct counting.
The query correctly filters patients with a normal level of anti-centromere using T2.CENTROMEA IN ('-', '+-'), meeting the specified condition.
The query correctly filters patients with a normal level of anti-SSB using T2.SSB IN ('-', '+-'), meeting the specified condition.
The query correctly filters to only include male patients with T1.SEX = 'M', fulfilling the male patient filtering requirement.
The query ensures each patient is counted only once in the final result by using COUNT(DISTINCT T1.ID).
